headline.main: Theedore Parker on the War in Italy.

docs.lead_paragraph: At a pic-nic, near Boston, of the Rev. THRODORX PARKEE'S congregation, on Wednesday, letters from Mr. PARKEE were read, dated Montreux, Switzerland, June 25, in which he spoke quite encouragingly of his health. Mr. PARKEE also writes as follows of the War: "A great struggle goes on in Europe to day, in all Europe.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE RETREAT OF THE AUSTRIAN ARMY. A correspondent of the London Times sends the following to that paper: "The following is from letters written at different dates to his wife by an officer holding a high command in the seventh (Baton Zonel's) corps of the Austrian army. The letters show that had Count GYULAI only let his generals alone, and gone to bad himself they would most probably have brought the

headline.main: TWO DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; CONSOLS 93 3-8. Examered Extraordinary Passage of an American Clipper A cross the Atlantic. COTTON Quiet and Steady---Breadstuffs and Provision Dull. ESTIMATES OF LOSSES ON BOTH SIDES. EVENTS AT THE SEAT OF WAR. ARRIVAL OF THE WESER. French Official Account of the Battle of Solferino.

headline.main: LAW REPORTS.; SURROGATE'S COURT. SUPREME COURT- COMMON PLEAS. MARINE COURT.

docs.lead_paragraph: Will of David Nichols.-This case has been several times before the Surrogate. The Will was admitted to Probate in April, 1858. By the provisions of the Will, the testator left a considerable property to his widow, also legacies to his sisters and his brother.

docs.snippet: Judge ROSE, the American Consul at Guaymas reached here this afternoon, and tendered his resignation to the Government. He made a thorough exploration of Sonora, and pronounces it the richest mineral country in the world. Governor PESCHIERA is now...

headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; FROM WASHINGTON Bursting of a Sixty-four Pound Gun at the Navy-Yard--- Loss of Life Matters in Sonora-- Indian Deprodations-- The Philadelphia Public Buildings, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Judge ROSE, the American Consul at Guaymas reached here this afternoon, and tendered his resignation to the Government. He made a thorough exploration of Sonora, and pronounces it the richest mineral country in the world. Governor PESCHIERA is now absent in Sonora, and the Indians are devastating all the upper and western portions of Sonora.

docs.snippet: The telegraph announced yesterday the melancholy intelligence that RUFUS CHOATE, of Massachusetts, was no more. Mr. CHOATE left Boston with a party of friends but a few weeks since in one of tire Cunard steamers, intending, if his strength would...
docs.lead_paragraph: The telegraph announced yesterday the melancholy intelligence that RUFUS CHOATE, of Massachusetts, was no more. Mr. CHOATE left Boston with a party of friends but a few weeks since in one of tire Cunard steamers, intending, if his strength would warrant it, to make a voyage to Europe, with the hope of improving his health.

headline.main: THE NEWS FROM EUROPE.; THE MAILS BY THE CANADA. FROM THE SEAT OF WAR IN ITALY. Excesses of Papal Oppression in the Romagna. WAR NEWS AT PARIS. Aspect of Affairs in London. THE VOYAGE OF THE GENERAL ADMIRAL. CORRESPONDENCE, EXTRACTS, DETAILS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The mails by the steamship Canada, forwarded from Boston, were received here last evening. We are thus placed in possession of our correspondence from Italy, from Paris, and from London; with our usual ample files of European journals. Many new, important, and highly interesting details are laid before the reader.
